definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Listen to me. I'm giving you pearls here.
sentences.chinese: 聽我說，這是我給你的金玉良言。

sentences.english: The old often give good advice to the young.
sentences.chinese: 老年人常常對年輕人提出金玉良言。

sentences.english: I am deeply grateful to you for your advice.
sentences.chinese: 我非常感謝你給我的金玉良言。

sentences.english: You regard the beneficial words as a puff of wind, and will regret it sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 你把金玉良言當作耳旁風，總有一天會後悔的。

sentences.english: Sometimes really can't live too numb, need some good advice to brainwashed.
sentences.chinese: 有時真的不能活得太麻木，需要一些金玉良言來洗腦。

sentences.english: You're the words in my books.
sentences.chinese: 你是我書裏的金玉良言。

sentences.english: Sage advice, I thought, as I was working on an important project.
sentences.chinese: 我在忙着一重要項目時，心想，這真是金玉良言啊。

sentences.english: His words are closely followed by the investment community.
sentences.chinese: 他的話被投資界奉爲金玉良言。

definition: words from the bottom of one's heart
loyal advice jars on the ears (idiom)
to repeatedly advise sb earnestly (idiom)/to admonish
murky darkness suddenly opens (idiom); a sudden flash of insight and all is clear
lit. to anoint your head with the purest cream (idiom); fig. to enlighten people with perfect wisdom/flawless Buddhist teaching
earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
